results.title: Dangerous Australians
results.creator_credit: Moira Mann, Yvonne Ellis and BBC
results.brief_description: Dangerous Australians is a nature program that looks at the venomous creatures that populate Australia. The program profiles such creatures as the red back and funnel web spiders, the blue ring octopus, the black tiger snake, the fierce snake, the sea snake, the box and man-of-war jellyfish, and various poisonous coral. The program also looks at sharks and crocodiles. Reconstructions of actual encounters between humans and various creatures illustrate the potential dangers of these encounters. The program questions why so many of the world’s most venomous creatures live in Australia and why these creatures, whose prey is often harmless, have such high toxicity levels.

results.title: Jamie: the story of a sibling
results.creator_credit: John Howe, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film shows how the emotional development of children is affected by parental attitudes and by competition for parental attention. Jamie in this film is a ten-year-old, an age when it hurts if you fail to win a parent’s approval, or if you must give way because you are the youngest in the family. Parents who want to know what goes on inside a child’s mind will find Jamie, and the family of which he is part, a provocative, revealing study. Intended for discussion purposes by only depicting the situation. Cast: Ron Cahoon, James Dougal, Jill Foster, Danny McIlravey, Paula McKeown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Howe, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Dangerous charter
results.creator_credit: Robert Gottschalk, John Moore and Gold Key Entertainment
results.brief_description: Three bluefin fishermen going about their daily routine find a luxury yacht, ‘Medusa’ drifting on the sea and decide to board her. Finding a dead body and no one else there, shipmates Marty, Kick and Joe see dollar signs appearing before their eyes and agree to salvage it. On dry land the F.B.I and coast guard are intrigued by the mysterious vessel. Marty and co. are allowed to keep the yacht on one condition- that they are used as fish bait to catch the owner of the vessel, a man believed to be a wealthy criminal involved in narcotics. The bait is taken and the drama begins. With corny humour and some bad acting, one could think the film may not stay afloat, however the well paced story line seems to keep the movie moving along enjoyably. Cast includes Chris Warfield, Sally Fraser and Richard Foote.

results.title: Jamie: a behavioural approach to family intervention (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: J Loebsen and University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center
results.brief_description: Jamie is a pre-school child whose behaviour problems disturb his family life. Jamies’ parents discuss with a therapist their response to Jamie’s behaviour and the benefits of the classes they attend, which provide a program to modify both Jamie’s actions and his parents attitude to his behaviour.

results.title: Dancehall queen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don Letts, Rick Elgood, Carl Bradshaw, Carolyn Pfeiffer, Hawk's Nest Productions and Island Jamaica Films
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Kingston, Jamaica, “Dancehall Queen”s’ plot centres on the travails of Marcia, a struggling single mother who works as a street vendor to support her two daughters. Threatened by a benefactor who demands sexual favours from her teenage daughter, and a thug intent on destroying her vending business, she enters a dance hall contest and regains control of her life. The highlight of the film is the depiction of Jamaica’s vibrant dancehall culture. The dancehall, which historically provided a vital space for the development of reggae music, continues to be one of Jamaica’s most energized environments, bubbling with a creativity expressed through outrageous fashions, defiant sexual expression, innovative dance steps, a distinct vernacular and, of course, its ever evolving music. Dancehall music is the present day form of Jamaican reggae, voicing the young (and the not so young) population’s concerns, conflicts, fantasies and frustrations, while offering escapist, humorous observations of oppressive situations. While dancehall music is dominated by men, the dancing is ruled by women who compete with each other to come up with the most risque costumes—characterised by excessive amounts of jewelry, pastel-colored wigs and thigh-high patent leather boots—and the most sexually provocative dance moves. Though the Jamaican Patois English is sometimes hard to decipher, “Dancehall Queen” offers a vibrant portrayal of contemporary Jamaica. Includes music from Beenie Man, Chevelle Franklyn, Bounty Killer, The Marley Girls and Grace Jones.

results.title: Dance with teletubbies
results.creator_credit: David G. Hillier, Vic Finch, Andrew Davenport, Anne Wood, BBC and Ragdoll Productions
results.brief_description: Teletubbies is a TV show that originated on the BBC and has proven to be especially popular among younger children. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po live in a magical land over the hills and far away, where television comes from - a land where anything can happen. Come and dance with the Teletubbies as they discover how to move their bodies to music!

results.title: Dance with a stranger
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Roger Randall-Cutler and First Film Company
results.brief_description: The story of Ruth Ellis, a woman tortured by her love for a cruel man who demanded and took from her more than she could possibly give. Her only escape was to rid herself of the terrible pain he caused, so she shot him dead in cold blood. She was convicted of murder and became the last woman in England to be hanged. Starring Miranda Richardson, Rupert Everett and Ian Holm.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, Argos and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent, and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and has inspired fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Jabberwocky” interprets Lewis Carroll’s verse as a last magical adventure before adulthood; “J.S. Bach: fantasia in G minor” probes the mystery of the real with the great composer’s help; domestic mayhem is on the menu in “Punch and Judy”; while “Leonardo’s diary” transports the renaissance polymath to the twentieth century; “The Ossuary” tours the ultimate bone-yard, a monument to the Black Death; and in “The Death of Stalinism in Bohemia” Svankmajer hammers an animated nail in the coffin of Czech communism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Svankmajer, Argos and British Film Institute

results.title: Jamon jamon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jose Bigas Luna, Andres Gomes, Lola Films and Ovideo TV
results.brief_description: Bigas Luna co-wrote and directed “Jamon jamon”, which stars Penelope Cruz and Javier Bardem, both Spanish actors who would go on to achieve fame in America. “Jamon jamon” is a comedy/drama set in the arid region of Monegros, Spain. Jose Luis is a young executive working in an underwear factory, run by his overbearing mother and passive father. Luis is having a relationship with a factory girl Silvia (Cruz) who is pregnant with his child. Jose’s mother Conchita, is horrified by the thought of her son marrying anyone at all, let alone a factory worker whose mother is a prostitute. Conchita sets about scuttling her son’s plans by hiring Raul, a handsome would be bullfighter to woo Silvia. Complications ensue all round as Conchita takes a liking to Raul herself and Jose cannot pass up his fondness for sleeping with Silvia’s mother (who also has a past history with Jose’s father). “Jamon jamon” is a film about sex, love, infidelity, passion, loyalty and family. Heavy symbolism reflects a macho culture driven by male desire for assuaging of ego and ratification of sexual prowess. Features numerous erotic heterosexual scenes. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1992 Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Jamie Oliver: Pukka tukka
results.creator_credit: Brian Klein, Jamie Oliver and Video Collection International
results.brief_description: Naked chef Jamie Oliver challenges the notion that fast food is easier and cheaper than any pucker tucker. Pitting his culinary skills against leading brands of instant meals, he creates his own variations on pasta, salmon, and an apple and blackberry crumble to prove that he comes in quicker and cheaper with home variations. Jamie also finds time to drop in on friends with a variety of backgrounds and budgets, in Coventry, Manchester and London and creates a range of dishes including: slow-roasted leg of pork with spicy scratching; sticky chocolate sauce pudding; celeriac and potato gratin; tray baked field mushrooms with garlic, butter and thyme; apricot and pistachio tarte tatin; sea bass with fennel and olives; white risotto with lemon thyme, sliced prosciutto, pecorino, parmesan and crumbled goats cheese. He also outlines the vital ingredients of a pantry.
